title: Spreadic Data Definition
description: It contains the data definition for Spreadic's semantic layer, including the models and access profiles.

models.description: The list of models in the given domain

items.description: Model is a logical entity composed of data element(s) (column(s)), e.g. orders, customers

name.description: The name of the given model

columns.description: The list of column object(s) belonged to the given model

description.description: The description of the given model

access_profiles.description: The list of access profiles defined for the given domain

items.description: Access profile encapsulates the rules and users to provide restricted access to the underlying data elements (models, columns, rows) in the given domain

name.description: The name of the given access profile

rules.description: The list of access rules associated with the given access profile

admin.description: The flag to indicate whether or not the given access profile defines the user(s) as Spreadic administrator(s)

access.description: The list of user(s), in form of email address(es), that is/are included in the given access profile

description.description: The human-readable description of the given access profile

model_meta.description: The metadata of the given model

label.description: The label of the given model

restricted.description: The flag to indicate whether or not the given model is restricted from general access

sets.description: The list of sets associated with the given model

joins.description: The list of rule(s) to cross-join other model(s)

column.description: Column is a basic data element that contains most granular details of a logical entity, e.g. customer_country, order_id. Column can either be a dimension or a metric.

name.description: The name of the given column

description.description: The description of the given column

column_meta.description: The metadata of the given column

dimensions.description: The list of dimension columns related to the given base column

metrics.description: The list of metric columns related to the given base column

dimension.description: Dimension column is a natural or calculated attribute of a logical entity without aggregation, e.g. customer_country, order_id, brand_name

hidden.description: The flag to indicate whether or not the given dimension column should be hidden

label.description: The label of the given dimension column

description.description: The description of the given dimension column

sql.description: The SQL statement to define a calculated dimension, e.g. customers.first_name || ' ' || customers.last_name. Note that the columns used have to be fully qualified (i.e. [schema].[column]).

restricted.description: The flag to indicate whether or not the given dimension column is restricted from general access

time_intervals.description: The list of time intervals extended from the given dimension column

items.description: The time interval for date column extension. Allowable values are 'RAW', 'DAY', 'WEEK', 'MONTH' and 'YEAR'.

metric.description: Metric column is an aggregated column on a base column

label.description: The label of the given metric column

description.description: The description of the given metric column

type.description: The type of the given metric column. Allowable values are 'number' (a SQL statement needs to be filled), 'count', 'max', 'min', 'sum' and 'count_distinct'.

sql.description: The SQL statement to define the given metric should be derived. It's only interpreted for 'number' type. Note that the columns used have to be fully qualified (i.e. [schema].[column]).

restricted.description: The flag to indicate whether or not the given metric column is restricted from general access

set.description: Set is a collection of columns with optionally defined filtering and ordering

name.description: The name of the given set

columns.description: The list of the columns under the given set

label.description: The label of the given set

description.description: The description of the given set

sql_filter.description: The optional SQL where clause to define the filtering injected when the given set is chosen

sql_ordering.description: The optional SQL ordering clause to define any default ordering when no ordering is provided

join.description: Join rule is to define how cross-join operation is carried out

model.description: The name of the target model to be joined by the current model

sql_on.description: The condition of joining the current model and the target model, e.g. orders.customer_id = customers.id. Note that the columns used have to be fully qualified (i.e. [schema].[column]).

columns.description: The list of column name(s) in the target model to be included in the current model after joining

rule.description: Access rule is define access control behaviour at the model, row and column levels

model.description: The target model for the given access rule

sql_filter.description: The row-level access control, in form of a SQL where clause, e.g. customer.customer_country = 'United Kingdom'. Note that the columns used have to be fully qualified (i.e. [schema].[column]).

columns.description: The column-level access control, in form of a list of column name(s) in the target model that the given profile rule allows access
